CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 17, 1970, pg. 1 reads: " BCC, Unions Agree - Left to right, Pat Navarro, Nate Smith, Angelo Carboni, and Judge David Olbum, examined the finalized draft of the new Pittsburgh Plan, designed to integrate Pittsburgh's construction industry." The Pittsburgh Plan was an agreement between the Master Builders Association, the Pittsburgh Building Trades Council, and members of the Black Construction Coalition, to train African American men for entry into the unions and employment in construction industry.
TitMainTitle: Pasquale Navarro, Nate Smith, Angelo Carboni, and Judge David Olbum holding document, for press conference to announce signing of the Pittsburgh Plan
